Radio: Toggle Button

  • HTML
  • View
  • Context
  • Info
  • Notes 
<div class="btn-group" role="group" aria-label="Basic example">
    <input type="radio" class="form-check-input btn-check" id="radio-id" name="radio-name" value="radio-value">
    <label for="radio-id" class="btn btn-outline-primary">ON</label>
    <input type="radio" class="form-check-input btn-check" id="radio-id-2" name="radio-name" value="radio-value" checked>
    <label for="radio-id-2" class="btn btn-outline-primary">OFF</label>
</div>
 
<div class="btn-group" role="group" aria-label="Basic example">{% render '@base-form', {type: type, text:"ON",inputClass: 'btn-check', labelClass: 'btn-outline-primary'}%}{% render '@base-form', {type: type, text:"OFF",checked: true, id: 2, inputClass: 'btn-check', labelClass: 'btn-outline-primary'}%}
    </div>
 
{
  "type": "radio",
  "options": [
    "checkbox 1",
    "checkbox 2"
  ],
  "variants": [
    {
      "name": "disabled"
    }
  ]
}
  • Handle: @radio--toggle-button
  • Variants (5): Default , Disabled , Inline , Switch , Toggle Button
  • Preview:
    • With layout
    • Component only
  • Filesystem Path: components\01-atoms\02- form\04-radio\radio--toggle-button.njk
  • References (1): @base-form

Checkbox

Browser default checkboxes are replaced with the help of .form-check, that improves the layout and behavior of their HTML elements, that provide greater customization and cross browser consistency.

Checkboxes are for selecting one or several options in a list

Structurally, our <input>s and <label>s are sibling elements as opposed to an <input> within a <label>. This is slightly more verbose as you must specify id and for attributes to relate the <input> and <label>. We use the sibling selector (~) for all our <input> states, like :checked or :disabled. When combined with the .form-check-label class, we can easily style the text for each item based on the <input>’s state.

Our checks use custom Bootstrap icons to indicate checked or indeterminate states.

<div class="form-check">
  <label class="form-check-label" for="idToReferenceLabel">
    Default checkbox<input class="form-check-input" type="checkbox" value="" id="idToReferenceLabel">
  </label>
</div>
<div class="form-check">
  <label class="form-check-label">
    Default checkbox<input class="form-check-input" type="checkbox" value="">
  </label>
</div>

Inline

Group checkboxes or radios on the same horizontal row by adding **.form-check-inline** to any *.form-check.*
